Guidance

Please select your clinical context to receive tailored guidance on placenta handling.

Information for Parents

This guidance will help you safely handle and dispose of the placenta according to health regulations.

Clinical Guidance

Professional guidance for handling placentas in clinical settings.

Important Hygiene Note

Always follow standard hygiene precautions when handling placenta to reduce infection risk:

  • Wear gloves
  • Wash hands thoroughly before and after
  • Avoid contact between blood from placenta and breaks in the skin

Home Burial Requirements

  • Bury placenta at least 1 meter deep to prevent contamination
  • Placenta should be free of plastic cord clamps
  • Do not bury in non-biodegradable containers
  • Choose location that won't contaminate water supply

Returning to Hospital

If you choose to return the placenta to the hospital:

  • Place in 2 sealed bags within a leak-proof container
  • Label clearly as "Human Tissue - Placenta"
  • Return to maternity unit or designated collection point

Warning: Improper Disposal

Placenta cannot be disposed of in domestic waste bins due to biohazard risks.

Please choose either home burial (following guidelines) or return to hospital for proper disposal.
